alert.note: Alert for Brewster (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 9:29AM CDT until August 30 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Rio Grande at Presidio International Bridge affecting Presidio County. Rio Grande below Presidio 5SE affecting Presidio County. Rio Grande at Castolon affecting Brewster County. .Heavy rainfall in the Rio Grande and Rio Conchos basins has resulted in elevated flows on the Rio Grande, including minor flood in some places. For the Rio Grande...including Presidio International Bridge, Presidio 5SE, Castolon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rio Grande at Castolon. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet (4.0 meters), the river reaches bankfull, and no significant damage is expected. At 15.0 feet (4.6 meters), the river reaches minor flood stage, and lowland flooding begins. The river begins to flood the road between Santa Elena Canyon and Cottonwood Campground in Big Bend National Park. The river begins to flood the parking lot at Santa Elena Canyon, and cut off the nature trail into the canyon. Campers in Cottonwood Campground need to prepare for possible evacuations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 5.2 feet (1.6 meters). - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 15.9 feet (4.8 meters) late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet (4.6 meters). - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Sun Sun Mon Mon Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1pm 7pm 1am 7am Rio Grande Castolon 15.0 5.2 Sun 9am 5.6 10.3 15.3 15.9 Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (meters): Fld Observed Sun Sun Mon Mon Location Stg Stg Day/Time 1pm 7pm 1am 7am Rio Grande Castolon 4.6 1.6 Sun 9am 1.7 3.1 4.7 4.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM CDT.
